intro: Codonopsis javanica subsp. japonica, commonly known as Japanese ginseng, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its erect stems and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its roots are often harvested for medicinal use due to their purported health benefits. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly smaller size and different floral morphology compared to the main species.
